content.prompt: A grocery store sells perishable and nonperishable food.  Each item in the store has a bar code, a 9-digit positive integer. The bar code of perishable items ends with 3, 4, or 7. Write a program that checks one integer, the barcode of a single item, whether the item is perishable or not. The variable, perishable, is True if it is perishable, and false otherwise. If the given integer is not a 9-digit positive integer, then perishable should be False.Assume that the barcode value is already stored in a variable called barcode.E.g. 1: If the barcode is 342564643, perishable is True since the barcode finishes with 3.E.g. 2: If the barcode is 442554645, perishable is False since the barcode finishes with 5.E.g. 3: If the barcode is 325, perishable is False since the barcode is not a 9-digit integer.Authors: Yana Kortsarts, Yulia Kempner, Leonid Kugel, Kamil Akhuseyinoglu
